content.question: <math alttext="Pressure, in atmospheres" overflow="scroll"><mi>P</mi><mo> </mo><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>atm</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> <math alttext="Volume sub experimental, in liters" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>V</mi><mi>experimental</mi></msub><mo> </mo><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi mathvariant="normal">L</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> <math alttext="Volume sub ideal, in liters" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>V</mi><mi>ideal</mi></msub><mpadded><mo> </mo><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi mathvariant="normal">L</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> <math alttext="0.200" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.200</mn></math> <math alttext="122.2" overflow="scroll"><mn>122.2</mn></math> <math alttext="122.2" overflow="scroll"><mn>122.2</mn></math> <math alttext="2.000" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.000</mn></math> <math alttext="12.17" overflow="scroll"><mn>12.17</mn></math> <math alttext="12.22" overflow="scroll"><mn>12.22</mn></math> <math alttext="8.000" overflow="scroll"><mn>8.000</mn></math> <math alttext="2.925" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.925</mn></math> <math alttext="3.055" overflow="scroll"><mn>3.055</mn></math> The pressure of a sample of <math alttext="N H 3, gas" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>NH</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> was changed by adjusting the volume of the container. The experimental volumes that were needed to achieve the desired pressures were different from the volumes predicted by the ideal gas law as shown in the table above. Which of the following best explains the difference between the experimental volumes and the volumes predicted by the ideal gas law?

choices.label: The attraction between the molecules becomes significant at high pressure.
The repulsion between the molecules becomes significant at high pressure.
The average speed of the molecules decreases as the pressure increases.
The average speed of the molecules increases as the pressure increases.

content.answer: The attraction between the molecules becomes significant at high pressure.

skill.text: 4.D: Explain the degree to which a model or representation describes the connection between particulate-level properties and macroscopic properties.
